intro: Ilysanthes capensis, commonly known as the Cape ilysanthes, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Ilysanthes capensis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and resilience in challenging environments.
